title: Emily in Paris: Ukraine complains over Kyiv character stereotype
description: Ukraine's culture minister has described the portrayal of a character from Kyiv as "insulting".

title: Sudan coup: Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigns after mass protests
description: Abdalla Hamdok's resignation comes weeks after he was reinstated by the military following a coup.

title: Aoife Beary: Berkeley balcony collapse survivor dies, aged 27
description: The Irishwoman suffered serious injuries in a Californian balcony collapse that killed six students.

title: South Africa parliament: Man arrested over massive fire
description: Police in Cape Town say a man is facing several charges over the fire and will appear in court on Tuesday.

title: Stokes has no ambition to be England captain
description: Ben Stokes says he does not aspire to be England captain and gives his backing to current skipper Joe Root.

title: Colorado wildfire: Two people remain missing and presumed dead
description: A local sheriff previously said it had been a miracle no-one was reported missing or dead.

title: Twitter bans US Congresswoman for Covid post
description: The congresswoman was suspended after tweeting falsely about high levels of vaccine related deaths.

title: Chelsea 2-2 Liverpool: Mateo Kovacic & Christian Pulisic cancel out Mane & Salah goals in thriller
description: Chelsea come from two goals down to claim a point against Covid-hit Liverpool in a Premier League classic at Stamford Bridge.

title: Nothing in data to support new curbs in England - ministers
description: But a senior doctor urges action to bring case numbers down as hospitals cope with staff absences.

title: Covid: Israel Omicron spike could bring herd immunity but with risks - health boss
description: Health boss says Omicron may lead to herd immunity but it would be better achieved via vaccination.

title: Covid: Pupils to wear masks in class in England's secondary schools to tackle Omicron
description: The move aims to tackle concerns about secondary schools staying open for face-to-face lessons this term.

title: Leeds United 3-1 Burnley: Hosts move eight points clear of drop
description: Leeds end a three-game losing run in the Premier League with a victory over Burnley that adds to the Clarets' own relegation fears.

title: E-scooter rider, 74, dies in crash with parked cars
description: Police say the man collided with two cars that were parked on the side of the road.

title: Covid: Workplaces told to plan for absences of up to 25%
description: Rising Covid cases could see a worst case scenario of up to a quarter of staff off work, the government says.

title: Memorial: Russia’s civil rights group uncovering an uncomfortable past
description: Memorial, one of the oldest civil rights groups in Russia, was uncovering uncomfortable truths for the authorities.

title: EU flag removed from Arc de Triomphe after right-wing outrage
description: The French government denies bowing to far-right pressure over the flag at the Arc de Triomphe.

title: Zaian Aimable-Lina: Second murder arrest after boy stabbed to death
description: A 15-year-old boy is in custody while another boy, also 15, has been bailed until late January.

title: Eric Liddell: Olympic champion inducted into Scottish Rugby Hall of Fame
description: Olympic champion Eric Liddell has been inducted into Scottish Rugby's Hall of Fame on the 100th anniversary of his first cap.

title: England head coach Silverwood tests positive for Covid-19
description: England men's head coach Chris Silverwood tests positive for Covid-19, having already been set to miss the fourth Test after a family member's positive test.

title: Wales-Ireland walking route to celebrate Celtic links
description: The pilgrimage route will be developed in Wales and Ireland and aims to attract thousands each year.

title: Climate change: Living by coal tip leaves family fearing rain
description: Phil Thomas has even thought about which way to run "if something starts pouring down the hill".

title: Covid: Face masks in England's classrooms and staff absences may hit 25%
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday morning.

title: In the footsteps of the women who escaped a Nazi death march
description: When Gwen Strauss' great-aunt revealed she had led nine women in an escape from a Nazi death march in 1945, Gwen decided to retrace their steps.

title: Weight loss transformation for army veteran with PTSD
description: An ex-soldier from Cannock loses eight stone after running helped his mental health crisis.

title: Light pollution: Parkour group saving energy by turning off city lights
description: A group of young men are using their gymnastic abilities to reduce the impact of light pollution in their hometown.

title: Match of the Day analysis: Why Arsenal were 'outstanding' despite losing to Man City
description: Match of the Day's Ian Wright and Dion Dublin look at the reasons why Arsenal were able to "impose" themselves so well on Manchester City, despite eventually losing 2-1.

title: BBC Sound of 2022: Colourful rapper Central Cee kicks off the countdown
description: The west Londoner scored a top 10 album in 2021 and is up for three Brit Awards. Here's why.
